Extreme fluctuations in extent of occurrence (EOO). This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)
Continuing decline in number of locations. This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)
Extreme fluctuations in the number of locations. This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)
Very restricted in area of occupancy (AOO) and/or # of locations. This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)

Description: Extreme fluctuations? (in # of mature individuals). This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)
Severely fragmented? This field can take the following values: "1" (meaning true), "0" (meaning false), or "U" (meaning “unknown”)

Continuing decline % in mature individuals within 2 generations or 5 years, whichever is longer, note to not go 100 years in future

Number of mature individuals in largest subpopulation

The Red List assessment Category value. They should take one of the values : CR, DD, EN, EW, EX,LC,NE,NR,NT,VU

A tokenised Red List assessment criteria string. This must comprise of individual criteria tokens, separated by commas. For example, the following criteria string: "B1ab(ii,iii,iv,v)+2ab(ii,iii,iv,v)" should be represented as follows: "B1a,B1bii,B1biii,B1biv,B1bv,B2a,B2bii,B2biii,B2biv,B2bv". You may also use the pipe character (|) to delimit criteria tokens, for example: "B1a|B1bii|B1biii|B1biv|B1bv|B2a|B2bii|B2biii|B2biv|B2bv". Note: this field takes precedence over RedListCriteria.manualCriteriaString. If both are provided, only RedListCriteria.manualCriteria is considered.
Obs: Only required if CR, EN, VU

Description: A literal Red List assessment criteria string. This should only be used in cases where it is impractical to provide criteria tokens via the RedListCriteria.manualCriteria field. Example: "B1ab(ii,iii,iv,v)+2ab(ii,iii,iv,v)". This field is ignored when RedListCriteria.manualCriteria is present.
Obs: Only required if CR, EN, VU

Description: Possibly Extinct - should be TRUE or FALSE. It will be FALSE by default, and a TRUE value will only be accepted if TRUE is provided
Possibly Extinct in the Wild - should be TRUE or FALSE. It will be FALSE by default, and a TRUE value will only be accepted if TRUE is provided
Date Last Seen (only for EX, EW, or Possibly EX species): (NOTE: Year format)
Reason for Data deficiency, either Provenance or Taxonomic - for DD species only
Rationale for the Red List Assessment
Reason(s) for Change in Red List Category from the Previous Assessment
